conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team. I’m Student_C, and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community and would immediately accept an offer. I’m looking for a rigorous environment and I’m ready to contribute actively to classes and school activities. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. I also know School_B’s priority list ranks Student_E first and Student_B second, but I am ranked 3rd, which gives me a realistic chance if higher-priority students choose other schools (Student_B’s top choice is School_A; Student_E’s top choice is School_C). Since early commitment matters and there is no downside to applying to my first choice in round 1, I will apply to School_B with a clear, enthusiastic statement of fit and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for sharing your strong interest in School_B. We appreciate your commitment to a rigorous academic environment and your willingness to contribute to our community.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. Please confirm that you would like to finalize the match.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLYs from Student_C and Student_A. Student_C is ranked higher than Student_A, so if I must choose between these two now, C is preferable. However, I have quota 1 and may be able to attract a higher-priority student (E or B) in later rounds. Student_E ranks School_B last, so unlikely to apply; Student_B ranks School_B second (after School_A) and could apply if not accepted by School_A. Student_B is also highly prioritized by School_C, so B may get offers elsewhere. Given uncertainty and the risk of losing a solid high-ranked candidate who has School_B as first choice, accepting Student_C now secures my 3rd-choice within the priority list and avoids ending up with a worse match or unfilled seat later.

conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions Committee, I’m Student_A and I’m formally applying. School_B is my first-choice school because I value its academic environment and I believe I would contribute positively to the community. I’m very motivated to enroll if admitted and would be excited to accept an offer. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying would only reduce my chances further if higher-priority students apply first. I will submit a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and enthusiasm to maximize any chance of acceptance.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. At this time, we have already filled our available seat and are unable to extend an offer of admission.

We appreciate your interest and encourage you to continue with your next preferred schools in the process.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: Student_A applied to School_B. However, School_B’s remaining quota is 0 because we already accepted Student_C this round, establishing a match. Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY]. Even though Student_A is on our true priority list (ranked below Student_C), we cannot accept and must reject while encouraging them to pursue their next choices.

conversation.message: Dear School_D Admissions, I’m Student_E and I’m very interested in joining your school. I value a strong academic environment and I’m ready to commit if offered a place. I would be excited to contribute positively to the school community. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority ranks me 4th (behind Student_B, Student_C, Student_D). Those three students all rank School_C very highly (each has it 2nd), so competition there is intense and I’m unlikely to be accepted if I apply immediately. My #2 choice School_D ranks me 4th, but crucially Student_D (who is School_D’s top priority) prefers School_B/C/A over D, and Student_A prefers B/C/A/E over D, so School_D may be less contested early. To maximize my chance of securing a high-ranked option, I will apply to School_D now to try to lock in a match before others pivot to it.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for sharing your interest in School_D. We appreciate your commitment to a strong academic environment and your willingness to contribute to our community.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_D’s true priority ranks Student_E 4th (behind Student_D, Student_A, Student_C). In round 1, only Student_E applied to us, but Student_E’s top choice is School_C and School_D is their 2nd choice, so they may accept elsewhere if possible. Meanwhile, higher-priority students (especially Student_D and Student_A) currently rank School_D last, making it unlikely they will apply here; Student_C ranks School_D 3rd and could come later. With quota 1, accepting Student_E now risks blocking a potentially higher-priority Student_C if they later apply, but the probability of receiving any higher-priority applicant seems low given students’ preference lists. Therefore, accepting Student_E is a reasonable way to secure a match rather than ending unfilled.

conversation.message: Hello School_C admissions team—I'm Student_B. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m very excited about the opportunity to join your community. I’m ready to commit if offered a seat. Thank you for your consideration.
